DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response indicating the type of radiation therapy administered to a patient.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to radiation therapy administered to a patient.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A type of radiation therapy in which a radioactive substance, such radioactive iodine or a radioactively labeled monoclonal antibody, is swallowed or injected into the body and travels through the blood, locating and killing tumor cells.

Concepts.definition: Radiation therapy in which radioactive drugs are administered orally or through an injection then circulate through the blood and collect in tumor sites where they kill cancer cells.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A type of external beam radiation therapy using a beam of protons. It has the advantage of precisely localizing the radiation dose on the targeted tissue and avoiding damage to the healthy surrounding tissues.

Concepts.definition: A type of external beam radiation therapy using a beam of protons. It has the advantage of precisely localizing the radiation dose on the targeted tissue and avoiding damage to the healthy surrounding tissues.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: External Beam Radiation Therapy Intensity-Modulated Radiation Therapy

ValueMeaning.preferredName: External Beam Radiation Therapy Intensity-Modulated Radiation Therapy
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Radiation therapy in which high-energy beams are delivered to the tumor from outside of the body.: An advanced form of 3-Dimensional Conformal Radiation Therapy (3D CRT) that involves the use of varying intensities of small radiation beams to produce dosage distributions that are more precise than those possible with 3D CRT.

Concepts.definition: Radiation therapy in which high-energy beams are delivered to the tumor from outside of the body.

An advanced form of 3-Dimensional Conformal Radiation Therapy (3D CRT) that involves the use of varying intensities of small radiation beams to produce dosage distributions that are more precise than those possible with 3D CRT.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: External Beam Radiation Therapy Three Dimensionality

ValueMeaning.preferredName: External Beam Radiation Therapy Three Dimensionality
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Radiation therapy in which high-energy beams are delivered to the tumor from outside of the body.: A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one.: The state of having dimensions; an indication of the dimensions associated with an object.

Concepts.definition: Radiation therapy in which high-energy beams are delivered to the tumor from outside of the body.
A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one.
The state of having dimensions; an indication of the dimensions associated with an object.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: External Beam Radiation Therapy Two Dimensionality

ValueMeaning.preferredName: External Beam Radiation Therapy Two Dimensionality
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Radiation therapy in which high-energy beams are delivered to the tumor from outside of the body.: A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.: The state of having dimensions; an indication of the dimensions associated with an object.

Concepts.definition: Radiation therapy in which high-energy beams are delivered to the tumor from outside of the body.
A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.
The state of having dimensions; an indication of the dimensions associated with an object.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: External Beam Radiation Therapy Not Otherwise Specified

ValueMeaning.preferredName: External Beam Radiation Therapy Not Otherwise Specified
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Radiation therapy in which high-energy beams are delivered to the tumor from outside of the body.: Not characterized in any other way.

Concepts.definition: Radiation therapy in which high-energy beams are delivered to the tumor from outside of the body.
Not characterized in any other way.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Internal Radiation Therapy Not Otherwise Specified

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Internal Radiation Therapy Not Otherwise Specified
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A type of radiation therapy in which radioactive material sealed in needles, seeds, wires, or catheters is placed directly into or near a tumor.: Not characterized in any other way.

Concepts.definition: A type of radiation therapy in which radioactive material is placed inside the body, into a tumor or body cavity.
Not characterized in any other way.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Internal radiation treatment that targets a cancerous tissue with low doses of radiation through the use of inserted temporary or permanent implants.

Concepts.definition: Internal radiation treatment that targets a cancerous tissue with low doses of radiation through the use of inserted temporary or permanent implants.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Internal radiation treatment that targets a cancerous tissue with accurate, high doses of radiation through the use of inserted temporary implants.

Concepts.definition: Internal radiation treatment that targets a cancerous tissue with accurate, high doses of radiation through the use of inserted temporary implants.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
